name: Madagascar Vanilla Perfume Oil
about: Fragrance Family:Warm & Spicy.Scent Type:Warm & Sweet Gourmands.Key Notes:Madagascar Vanilla Bean, Vanilla Orchid, Coconut.Fragrance Description:Capture the allure of Madagascar's landscape with this nourishing perfume oil featuring the warm essence of vanilla bean, the subtle floralcy of vanilla orchid, and a hint of coconut. It‚Äôs artfully blended with baobab oil for a formula that melts into your skin while leaving behind a long-lasting fragrance..About the Bottle:Housed in a jewel-like glass bottle tinted with a warm amber hue and featuring a dropper that offers a completely unique and customizable fragrance experience..About the Fragrance:This gourmand perfume oil features Madagascar vanilla, one of the most expensive crops in the world, in part because of the elaborate care it needs all season long. The vanilla orchid must be hand-pollinated by skilled harvesters, who then spend a year curing and drying each pod to perfection, giving dozens of local villages a source of livelihood.
ingredients: Fragrance (Parfum), Dipropylene Glycol, Triethyl Citrate, Ethyl Hexyl Glycerin, Propanediol, Adansonia Digitata Seed Oil (Baobab Oil), Benzyl Alcohol, Benzyl Salicylate, Linalool.
how_to_use: Suggested Usage:.-Glide over your arms, legs, d√©collet√©‚Äîanywhere on your body that you want to indulge with nourishment and a highly concentrated expression of exquisite fragrance. .-Ensure oil is fully absorbed prior to delicate fabrics coming in contact with skin.

reviews.review_title: Smells so good and lasts long
reviews.review_text: I received a sample of this perfume oil in a sephora best of vanilla sampler, and I have to say that this scent was most definitely my favorite. With the sampler, there was a certificate for a free travel size of any of the scents in the sampler, and I went with this one. I have gotten so many compliments on this! It is very aromatic and I feel like I can be smelled from a mile away (which is something that I was looking for. If you want something more subtle I wouldn't choose this fragrance). It is great for layering with other vanilla perfumes, as it is the perfect true vanilla scent. I highly recommend this.

reviews.review_text: This is by far my favorite vanilla scent, I love that it‚Äôs an oil, I feel like it last all day, you may not be able to smell it, but half way through my day someone will hug me and swoon over how good I smell, when I thought it was gone! Plus it pairs so nicely with my other vanilla perfumes! This small bottle lasted me a full year! I received my second bottle this year for Christmas! I‚Äôll be back for my third bottle next year! You better not discontinue this! lol I love it so much!

reviews.review_text: I am not a huge fragrance wearer as I‚Äôm super sensitive to scent so I tried this several times in store prior to purchasing and knew I loved it! Oil based perfumes are very concentrated so how you apply them is super important for your overall experience. A little goes a long way. Applying too much as well as how you apply it is definitely key. Apply to areas of the body that are warmer such as behind the ears, inner elbow and behind your knees as the heat will help release the fragrance throughout the day. It‚Äôs even more important with oil based perfumes to not ‚Äúrub‚Äù the oil onto the skin‚Äôs surface but tap it lightly to apply and allow it to dry onto the skin and absorb it naturally or the scent will be affected greatly.  I find it to be my go to as a base fragrance as it pairs so well with others such as the Nest Coconut or Sandalwood. It gets an A+++ from me!! A 10/10!!!

reviews.review_text: I got a sample vial of this and decided it was ok...just ok...but I really wanted to like it. So I ended up buying the rollerball. Funny enough, I actually find the rollerball sweeter than the sample vial. Maybe the rollerball is older and has sat longer?  There is just the tiniest bit too much spice/herbiness in this for me, but it does dry down to a nice warm, soft, but not overly sweet vanilla. It reminds me just a little bit of Philosophy Fresh Cream Cashmere when I sniff them side by side. Fresh Cashmere has a bit more sugary sparkle to it thought.  It has really grown on me. I have been layering it with Comptoir Sud Pacifique Vanille Extreme, Kayali 28, and Dulce by Rosie Jane. It gives these fragrances a bit more depth.  I think macerating it may be the trick, since the rollerball smells sweeter and nicer than the sample.

reviews.review_buyer_description: Brown eyes, Medium skin tone, Oily skin
reviews.review_text: EST New York's Madagascar Vanilla Perfume Oil has completely won me over. This fragrance is an exquisite journey into the world of vanilla, capturing the warmth and sweetness of this beloved scent in a truly enchanting way. From the moment I applied it, I was enveloped in a comforting and indulgent aroma that lasted for hours.  What sets this perfume oil apart is its authenticity. The rich, creamy vanilla notes are perfectly balanced, creating a fragrance that's not too overpowering but still leaves a lasting impression. The oil formulation adds a lovely depth to the scent, making it feel intimate and personal on my skin.  I also appreciate the convenient rollerball applicator that allows for precise and controlled application. This perfume oil is versatile ‚Äì perfect for both everyday wear and special occasions. The fact that it's long-lasting means I don't have to worry about reapplying throughout the day.  EST New York's Madagascar Vanilla Perfume Oil is a true gem for vanilla enthusiasts like myself. If you're in search of a high-quality, authentic vanilla fragrance, look no further ‚Äì this perfume oil is a delightful and captivating choice that will make you fall in love with vanilla all over again.

reviews.review_text: I've been working at Bath & Body Works for two years now, and I can honestly and confidently tell you that this smells EXACTLY like Warm Vanilla Sugar.   The dry down for Warm Vanilla Sugar is just going to be a little more sweeter because of those sugar notes, and the NEST perfume is just going to have more of those coconut notes to it, but it's Bath & Body Works-esque. It's very cheap smelling, nothing about this screams luxury or quality. Side by side, they smell almost identical, in my opinion.   I'm only giving it 2 stars because the scent is long-lasting on the skin, and it'd make a good layer scent for something like Warm Vanilla Sugar or another vanilla perfume with similar notes. But for the price point, I'm very disappointed because I was expecting more from the reviews. The scent itself is very overhyped, so I'd be cautious of that if you are looking to try out this perfume. I'm only keeping it to layer it with my Warm Vanilla Sugar. If you don't like that scent, I wouldn't even waste your time with this. There are better vanilla perfumes out there that are more affordable than this. ü§∑‚Äç‚ôÄÔ∏è
